page.title: 09LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Landscape is generally hilly and wooded with pasture and crops lower down. Houses mainly less than 100 years old as a building boon occurred at the turn of the century. However, there are a number of 15th century houses still occupied or incorporated into a newer building. Houses usually built of brick, some stone, one timber. Roofs usually tiled, some slate, a few Horsham slab (stone). Windows in modern houses are large and usually double glazed; in older houses latticed or lozenged-shaped. Some houses have curved and pierced wooden end boards under the eaves. Most house have garages and some have stabling. Barns and farm buildings; some wood and very old (some barns converted into houses) some brick, modern ones of asbestos or corrurgated
